111.content:
Pan was walking down the street, upset at seeing her grandfather Goku shrunk to the size of a kid after having her date ruine by the bank robbery. While she was walking, lost in her thoughts, Goku was following her.

"What do you want, Grandpa? I want to be alone right now" said Pan as she stopped and turne her head towards Goku.

"I thought we might catch up on things since I've been gone. We used to be close" replied Goku.

"And whose fault is that?! You're the one who left at the tournament and never visited for years while you were training your new student!" yelled Pan as she glared at Goku with her hands on her hips.

Goku gulped as Pan's glare reminded him of Chi-Chi and Videl and said "I'm sorry, Pan. I know I'm not a good father or grandfather, but I'm sorry. Can I make it up to you?"

"You're right you're not a good grandfather. In fact, with the way you are now, I'm not sure I should call you Grandpa anymore. I mean, I am taller than you now. What do you think, Goku?" asked a now smiling Pan.

Goku was shocked to hear Pan call him by just his name. He could feel something was changing between him and Pan, but he had no idea where this was headed. All he knew was that Pan seemed to no longer consider him her grandfather anymore.

"Come on, Goku", said a now excited Pan. "You want to make it up to me? Then you can do it by doing exactly as I tell you today. And apology accepted, Goku."

Pan grabbed Goku's hand and dragged Goku along to enjoy the rest of her day now that she was in a good mood again. She was also surprised by how easy it felt to call her grandpa by his name now that he was a kid again. She could feel things changing between them, but she had no idea where they were headed.

'Oh well', thought Pan. 'It's not important right now. I'm just going to enjoy the rest of my day with Goku.'

"Goku" said Pan as he finished drinking water.

"Yes, my Goddess?" responded Goku. As usual, Goku was avoiding her eyes and intead, looking at her feet.

"I have another important task for you."

"What is it, my Goddess?"

"As a goddess, I desire a throne to sit on, to showcase my power and status."

"You wish me to make you a throne, my Goddess?"

'No, I don't. I want you to become my throne."

Pan's statement shocked Goku so much that he fell to the ground, gazed at Pan's face for a second (and blushed really hard at her perfect face) before returning his gaze to her feet.

"My Goddess...you want me to become your throne? I am just a lowly mortal. I'm not worthy to be the throne to someone as perfect and divine as you. I..."

Goku hadn't realized that in his ramblings until he felt Pan put her hand on his mouth to quiet him.

"Look at my face, Goku," commanded Pan, to which Goku complied (and blushed again, like normal).

"This is a task only you can do, Goku. You are worthy to be my throne. Or do you doubt your Goddess?" Pan released her hand to let Goku.

"No my Goddess" said Goku. "I could never doubt you."

"Then prove it. Become my throne."

"I will, my Goddess."

Goku returned his gaze to the ground as he got on his knees and felt Pan sit on his back, claiming him as her throne.

Pan then directed him to move to the center of the cave and when he did, Pan looked around the entire cave as if it were her castle. Pan looked down at her shrunken grandfather and was amazed at how one day could change everything. Just this morning, he was still an adult. Now, not only was he returned to being a child, but now he was her throne and devout follower.

'Does Goddess Pan feel uncomfortable? Does my Goddess feel I'm going slow? She's not saying anything good or bad how I'm doing as her throne. What if she thinks I'm so bad that she abandon me? How can I go on without serving my Goddess?'

Goku took a mental sigh before he continued. 'Oh my dear Goddess Pan, I pray that I'm doing a good job and that you don't abandon me. I hope...'

Goku didn't finish his prayer as his nervousness was so great that he swayed a bit and crashed to the floor unconscious. Before he hit the floor, Pan flew a bit to avoid falling as well. Pan had a shocked face on her face. Pan didn't hear his first thoughts, but once he started praying to her, she heard him. Goku prayed to her and she heard it!

Pan decided to just sit quietly until Goku woke up. As Pan watched Goku, she thought about how much Goku was devoted to her now. He was so worried that he might have been doing a bad job or that she would abandon him that he lost consciousness right after praying to her.

After about twenty minutes, Goku began to wake up and before he finished, Pan stood up off the floor and dusted herself off a bit.

"What happened?" asked Goku as he was shaking his head a bit. "I was asked by my Goddess to be her throne and it was god for a bit, but then...did I faint? Is Goddess Pan alright?!"

Goku was starting to panic before the most wonderful voice in the universe, to Goku at least, began to speak.

"I'm fine, Goku. I flew a bit before you hit the ground."

"I'm so sorry, my Goddess! Please forgive me!" As usual, Goku kept his gaze to the ground so to avoid looking into Pan's eyes.

"It's alright. I was actually more surprised at what you did right before that.Do you remember?"

Goku thought for a second before he remembered. "Yeah, I prayed to you. Is that a problem? Shouldn't a goddess be prayed to?"

"No, it's not a problem. It actually made me happy. I was just surprised at how fast you did it."

Goku blushed at Pan saying that it made her happy.

"I did, but since you caught it, I'll fight you for it. I'll eat it all and if you win, you can eat it all."

We all agreed to calm her down a bit, but take that for a grain of salt. I know the sound of babysitting your grandfather sounds really weird, so you two just do whatever; try not to get into any major problems.

I love you and so does your Mom and the rest of us.

- Dad

She pulled away the blanket a bit and was even more surprised to see he was wearing nothing but a diaper. All of a sudden, she had an idea of why Pan wanted to stay, but she needed to talk with Pan to get the full story.

Videl left the room very quietly and took her suitcases downstairs. She then looked for Pan and saw that she was watching TV.

"Pan, we need to have a talk. About Goku."

Pan instantly knew that her mother had found out and nervously turned to her and said, "So you found out, huh?"

"Just tell me the whole story. I have to get going. What is going on?"

Pan then explained everything. From the game of house, to putting Goku in a diaper, to feeding him baby food, and even Goku peing himself and having to change him. Pan also explained how she tried to get Goku to call her FMommy, but she was unsuccessful at the moment, but he did start to refer to her as 'Miss Pan'. "Oh my god! That story was too funny. If I didn't see Goku in a diaper a moment ago, I wouldn't have belieeved it."

"So you're not mad, Mom, with what I've done to Goku?"

Videl noticed that Pan called Goku by name and replied, "No, of course not, Pan. I'm not mad. No matter how you look at this, this whole situation is Goku's fault. He left us all those years ago to train that Uub kid and then found himself in that situation where an old enemy of his accidentally wished him to be a kid again. This is Goku's fault for being reckless and selfish and thinking he can do whatever he wants without any consequences."

Videl walked to her Pan and placed her hand on Pan's shoulder. "Your father thought it would be best if Goku just grew up normally as a kid, which Chi-Chi obviously disagrees with, but now I see that Gohan's idea was right. I can think of no better punishment for Goku's behavior than for you, his own granddaughter, to be in charge of him. And if you can get him to call you Mommy, that would be even better. Perhaps you can reign in Goku's selfish behavior."

"But how would the rest of the family, especially Grandma, react to all this?"

"I'm not sure. I think it's best if we keep this a secret from the family. I don't think ohan and Goten could keep this a secret from Chi-Chi if she were to find out. I'll do what I can to help you, maybe I can convince Chi-Chi to divorce Goku, I don't know. I'll try to prlong our visit as long as possible. You keep doing what you're doing."

"Thanks, Mom," replied Pan as she gave her Mom a hug.

"I can't think of anything funnier if Goku were to call his own granddaughter 'Mommy'."

Her mom's approval and the fact that Chi-Chi had left for the time being to live with the Ox-King gave Pan more motivation to continue with what she was doing so that Goku would eventually refer to her as 'Mommy'.

Breaking the marriage between Goku and Chi-Chi would be the most crucial part, Pan knew. If they got divorced and Chi-Chi moved out of Mount Paozu, then there would be nothing left in Pan's way to have complete control of Goku. With her mom on her side, her dad would likely go with the flow and she figured that her Uncle Goten wouldn't be an obstacle to her; if he took the opportunity to move out of Mount Paozu as well, that'd be perfect for Pan.

As Pan entered the room, she noticed that Goku was starting to wake up.

"Did you have a nice nap, Goku?"

Goku looked at her in confusion for a moment until the memories from earlier came to his mind and he blushed in embarrassment. When he noticed the pacifer, he bluhed some more. He took it out of his mouth and said, "Yes, I did, Miss Pan."

Pan was happy that he was still calling her Miss Pan and she replied, "And I see that your diaper is dry. Goodd job!"

Goku blushed and averted his eyes at the subtle reminder of what happened earlier and he just remained silent. Pan then went to explain to Goku that the rest of their family, due to Chi-Chi, would be staying with the Ox-King for the time being and that it would just be the 2 of them for now.

"I see," said Goku, trying to fiure how he should feel about this. "My marriage to Chi-Chi has never been smooth and with me as a kid, maybe it's a good thing that she's gone for now. At leastt she isnt screaming and yelling in my face."

"What if Grandma decides she wants to get a divorce?" asked Pan, teting the waters for Goku's response.

"What's a divorce?"

Pan dropped her jaw in surprise. "You don't know what a divorce is? A divorce is a way to end a marriage. If you and Gandma got a divorce, you wouldn't be married anymore."

After hearing Pan's explanation, Goku still really didn't feel much.

"Maybe it's because I'm a kid again or maybe it's because I've been away from home for years, but maybe a divorce wouldn't be a bad thing. Gohan and Goten are both adults now and Chi-Chi could maybe find a new husband if she wanted to. It really wouldn't be fair to her if I were to remain a kid. I guess I don't love her like that anymore if I think it's okay for her to remarry, huh?"

Pan remained silent but inside, she was happy. She had a hunch that Goku wouldn't be too against a divorce and here he confirmed it to her. She hoped that her Mom could help convince Chi-Chi to go through with the divorce. In the meantime, Pan was thinking of how to have Goku think of her as his new mommy.

After dinner was over, Marron wanted to sign the adoption papers right away and she wanted Goku beside her when she did it, especially if there was any place that Goku needed to sign as well. Marron asked her mother to get the papers from where she had set them down earlier and 18 happily got them. The four of them all gathered in the living room and Marron and Goku sat beside each other on the couch.

"You now what these papers are for, Goku? Once I sign these papers and they get returned to the lawyer, I'll have officially adopted you. Isn't that great?"

"You mean all you have to do is sign some stuff and you'll really be my Mommy? Cool."

"Well it's going this fast becuse no else is trying to fight for custody of you," answered 18. "Also, since you have been married before, you have to sign in a place, giving Marron your permission to adopt you."

Marron looked at her mother and said, "That's right. Goku is married right now. Does Chi-Chi still want to be married to Goku?"

"No, she doesn't. I called her earlier and said that she wanted a divorce. She emailed me earlier a copy of divore papers that she drafted up with her respective signatures, but her terms of the divorce are that she gets all of Goku's property on Mount Paozu."

Android 18 pulled out the divorce papers. "As Goku's soon to be legal guardian, I didn't know if you wanted to fight it or-"

"I don't want to drag the divorce out between my son and Chi-Chi. He has a wonderful home here, he doesn't need his old home. What do you think, Goku?"

"So Chi-Chi really wants to leave me due to my reduced size, huh? I know I should feel sad or angry or something, but I don't. Maybe it's because I thought marriage was food when I first promised to marry her and thus probably got married too early. But Mommy, you're helping me get a new slate and this ddivorce helps that, right? I'm free to marry or not marry in the future. And so is Chi-Chi. Chi-Chi can have that property in Mount Paozu; I don't care either. I just want you to be my Mommy."

Marron was moved by Goku's utter devotion to her and happy that he was starting to sever his ties with his old family, starting with his (soon to be ex-)wife. Marron then took a pen and signed the adoption papers and then directed Goku to sign his consent on the adoption papers and then led him to where he needed to sign the divorce papers.

When the papers were all signed, 18 took them all and said, "The lawyer's office closes in about an hour. I'll take them to him right now to get these processed.

"Thanks, Mom."

"Thanks, Grandma."

"You both are welcome. Goku, welcome to your new family."

At those words, Goku looked at the four of them together and all though the circumstances were definitely not normal, Goku had no regrets of becoming Marron's son. He was very happy.

18 then left the house to fly to the lawyer's office.

Gine had retired from active duty to work in a meat factory prior to Frieza destroying Planet Vegeta. Gine had been brought back to life by the kais as since she was where Goku got his soft heart from they thought it would be good to bring her back to assist the now weakened hero. "Yes my name is Gine, Kakarot and I am your mother," Gine said to a now shocked Goku.

"You're my mom?!" Goku exclaimed stunned.

"I'm not sure…last thing I remember was Pilaf making a wish on a different set of Dragonballs called the Black Star Dragonballs, suddenly I'm a kid again and my power was cut to less than half of what it was" Goku told his newly found mother.

"If those black star dragonballs could weaken you this much Kakarot, they are extremely powerful and dangerous," Gine said worried on how her son would handle things in his weakened state. She knew in his weakened state anyone suspicious might try to take advantage of him.

info.brief_description: After being changed to a child, a female puts Goku in diapers.
info.description:
Goku has just been changed back to a child by the Black Star Dragon Balls and his family and friends are surprised. However, a female in Goku's life takes advantage of this to put Goku in diapers and treat him like her baby.

1.) Apart from Goku being changed back to a kid, the rest of GT is up in the air. Is the Earth still in danger of being destroyed? If so, who goes in search of them? Do they encounter the same villains? Etc. That is up to you, just be consistent within a particular storylinne.

2.) Apart from the setup chapters, have the chapters at a decent length. No super short chapters.

3.) Have the chapters legible. It does not have to contain perfect grammar, but it must be readable.

4.) Try not to end a story too short. Keep the stories ongoing as long as you can

5.) Do not kill Goku.


If I need to add any more rules, I will do so.
